intro: Gonystylus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered ironwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and strong, durable wood. The plant has small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruits are small, spherical drupes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its hardiness and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
